total number of diagnoses for this patient, including past diagnoses
results of glucose tolerance test
measures what percentage of your hemoglobin — a protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen — is coated with sugar (glycated)
drug used to treat type 2 diabetes
an antidiabetic drug in the class of medications known as meglitinides
an oral drug used to lower blood sugar (glucose) levels in type 2 diabetes. It is in a class of drugs called meglitinides
an oral diabetes medicine that helps control blood sugar levels. This medication helps your pancreas produce insulin
medium- to long-acting sulfonylurea antidiabetic drug
a first-generation sulfonylurea medication used to treat diabetes mellitus type 2, particularly in people whose diabetes cannot be controlled by diet alone
an oral diabetes medicine that helps control blood sugar levels by helping your pancreas produce insulin
an oral diabetes medicine that helps control blood sugar levels in a class of medications known as sulfonylureas
a first-generation potassium channel blocker, sulfonylurea oral hypoglycemic drug
a prescription drug of the thiazolidinedione (TZD) class with hypoglycemic (antihyperglycemic, antidiabetic) action to treat diabetes
an antidiabetic drug in the thiazolidinedione class of drugs. It works as an insulin sensitizer
slows the digestion of carbohydrates in the body, which helps control blood sugar levels
an oral anti-diabetic drug that acts by inhibiting the ability of the patient to break down complex carbohydrates into glucose
an antidiabetic and anti-inflammatory drug, and a member of the drug class of the thiazolidinediones
an oral blood glucose lowering drug used for people with Type 2 diabetes. It is part of the sulfonylurea family
Insulin is a hormone that is important for metabolism and utilization of energy from the ingested nutrients - especially glucose.

using both glipizide and metformin
using both glimepiride and pioglitazone
using both metformin and pioglitazone

whether any diabetes medications are administered
